#!/bin/bash
# NodeJS App Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server

# Update package list and install dependencies
apt-get update
apt-get install -y git curl jq file unzip make gcc g++ python3 python3-dev libtool

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

# Check if user uploaded their own files
if [ "${USER_UPLOAD}" == "true" ] || [ "${USER_UPLOAD}" == "1" ]; then
    echo -e "User upload detected. Skipping automatic installation."
    exit 0
fi

# Add .git extension if not present
if [[ ${GIT_ADDRESS} != *.git ]]; then
    GIT_ADDRESS=${GIT_ADDRESS}.git
fi

# Add authentication if username and token are provided
if [ ! -z "${USERNAME}" ] && [ ! -z "${ACCESS_TOKEN}" ]; then
    GIT_ADDRESS="https://${USERNAME}:${ACCESS_TOKEN}@$(echo -e ${GIT_ADDRESS} | cut -d/ -f3-)"
fi

# Clone or update repository
if [ "$(ls -A /mnt/server)" ]; then
    echo -e "/mnt/server directory is not empty."
    if [ -d .git ]; then
        echo -e ".git directory exists"
        if [ -f .git/config ]; then
            echo -e "Loading info from git config"
            ORIGIN=$(git config --get remote.origin.url)
        else
            echo -e "Files found with no git config"
            echo -e "Exiting to avoid breaking existing setup"
            exit 10
        fi
    fi

    if [ "${ORIGIN}" == "${GIT_ADDRESS}" ]; then
        echo "Pulling latest changes from repository"
        git pull
    fi
else
    echo -e "/mnt/server is empty. Cloning repository..."
    if [ -z "${BRANCH}" ]; then
        echo -e "Cloning default branch"
        git clone ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    else
        echo -e "Cloning branch: ${BRANCH}"
        git clone --single-branch --branch "${BRANCH}" ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    fi
fi

# Install Node.js packages
echo "Installing Node.js packages..."

# Check Node.js version for compatibility
NODE_VERSION=$(node --version | cut -d'v' -f2 | cut -d'.' -f1)
echo "Detected Node.js version: v${NODE_VERSION}"

# For older Node.js versions, use legacy npm commands
if [ ${NODE_VERSION} -lt 4 ]; then
    echo "Using legacy npm for older Node.js version"
    if [ -f /mnt/server/package.json ]; then
        npm install --production --legacy-bundling
    fi
    if [[ ! -z ${NODE_PACKAGES} ]]; then
        npm install ${NODE_PACKAGES} --legacy-bundling
    fi
else
    # Modern Node.js versions
    if [ -f /mnt/server/package.json ]; then
        npm ci --only=production --no-audit --no-fund
    fi
    if [[ ! -z ${NODE_PACKAGES} ]]; then
        npm install ${NODE_PACKAGES} --no-audit --no-fund
    fi
fi

# Check for package-lock.json or yarn.lock for newer versions
if [ -f /mnt/server/package-lock.json ] && [ ${NODE_VERSION} -ge 8 ]; then
    echo "Found package-lock.json, using npm ci"
    npm ci --only=production --no-audit --no-fund
elif [ -f /mnt/server/yarn.lock ]; then
    echo "Found yarn.lock, attempting to use yarn"
    if command -v yarn &> /dev/null; then
        yarn install --production --ignore-engines
    else
        echo "Yarn not available, falling back to npm"
        npm install --production --no-audit --no-fund
    fi
fi

echo -e "Installation complete!"
exit 0
